lines.text: He says the sun came out last night. He says it sang to him.
Have you recently had a close encounter?
If everything's ready here on the Dark Side of the Moon... play the five tones.
I guess you've noticed something a little strange with Dad. It's okay, though. I'm still Dad.

Is that it? Is that all you're gonna ask me? Well I got a couple of thousand goddamn questions, you know. I want to speak to someone in charge. I want to lodge a complaint. You have no right to make people crazy! You think I investigate every Walter Cronkite story there is? Huh? If this is just nerve gas, how come I know everything in such detail? I've never been here before. How come I know so much? What the hell is going on around here? Who the hell are you people?
Major Walsh, it is an event sociologique.
[last lines]

[looking up at the space ship flying away]
Goodbye.
TWA 517 do you want to report a UFO, over? TWA 517 do you want to report a UFO, over?

[over radio]
Negative, we don't want to report.
Air East 31, do you wish to report a UFO, over?

[over radio]
Negative, we don't want to report one of those either.
Air East 31, do you wish to file a report of any kind to us?

[over radio]
I wouldn't know what kind of report to file, Center.
Uh Air East 31, uh, me neither.

I know this sounds crazy, but ever since yesterday on the road, I've been seeing this shape. Shaving cream, pillows... Dammit! I know this. I know what this is! This means something. This is important.
Just close your eyes and hold your breath and everything will turn real pretty.
I don't understand these fractions.
What's one third of sixty?

[bewildered]
That's a fraction, I don't understand them.

[using a model train as an object lesson]
Alright, let's say that this boxcar is sixty feet long, OK?, and one third of it is across this switch here, alright... And now another train is coming... Now, how far do you have to move this boxcar so that the other train doesn't smash it? Quickly Brad, there are thousands of lives at stake... Brad any answer...
[CRASH]
Einstein WAS right!
Einstein was PROBABLY one of them!
We didn't choose this place! We didn't choose these people! They were invited!
They belong here more than we.
All right, everybody to bed!
No, wait! Dad said we could watching The Ten Commandments!
Roy, that movie is four hours long.
I said they could watch the five commandments.
[Roy is shoveling soil into his kitchen window]
Ronnie, if I don't do this, *that's* when I'm going to need a doctor.
You can come and play now.
You can't fool us by agreeing with us.
Dad, after this can we throw dirt in MY window?

[at press conference to discuss UFOs]
I saw Bigfoot once!
[everyone in thr room reacts. The Farmer stands up]
1951! It made a sound that I would not want to hear twice in my life.
[sits down]

[the Neary children watch The Ten Commandants on TV]
You know, that movie is four hours long.
I said they'd only watch five.
Mr. Neary, what do you want?
I just want to know that it's really happening.

[contemplating the lump shape]
This means something. This is important.

[checking the paper]
Hey, you know what's playing tonight? Pinocchio! You guys have never seen Pinocchio, you're in luck!
Aw, who wants to see some dumb cartoon rated 'G' for kids?
How old are you?
Eight.
You wanna be nine?
Yeah.
Then you're going to go see Pinocchio tomorrow night.
[Brad makes a disgusted gesture, but shuts up]
Roy, that is a terrific way to win over your children.
I'm not serious, I'm just saying that I grew up with Pinocchio, and if kids are still kids, they're going to eat it up.
[Ronnie looks at him in disgust]
Okay, I'm wrong, all right? I'm Wrong Roy.
[Yells at his youngest son, who is demolishing his sister's doll]
TOBY! You are close to death! Come out here!
[Toby giggles, but obeys]

Okay, let's have a vote. Tomorrow night you can play Goofy Golf, which is a lot of standing in line and shoving and pushing, and probably getting a 'zero,' or you can see Pinocchio, which is a lot of furry animals and magic, and you'll have a wonderful time. Okay? So let's vote.
[the kids all vote for golf]
Who flies crates like these anymore?
No one. These planes were reported missing in 1945.
I wanna speak to the man in charge.
Mr. Lacombe is the highest authority.
He isn't even an American.
That's a 2500 dollar globe! What are you guys doing?

[Plotting about how to clear the Devil's Tower area of its population]
Contaminated water. Affects people, crops, animals. Disease.
Yeah, epidemic.
What kind of disease?
A plague. A plague epidemic.
Nobody's gonna believe a plague in this day and age.
*Anthrax.*
Ranching country.
Yes!
There are a lot of sheep up in those hills.

Wait, that's good, that's good, I like that. But it may not evacuate everybody. There's always some joker who thinks he's immune. What I need is something so scary it'll clear three hundred square miles of every living Christian soul.
Roy, what did it look like?
It was like an ice cream cone.
What flavor?
Orange. It was orange - and it wasn't like an ice cream cone. It was, it was more like a shell. You know, it was like this.

Like a taco? Was it like one of those Sara Lee, um, moon-shaped cookies? Those crescent cookies? Don't you think I'm taking this really well? I remember when we used to come to places like this just to look at each other... and snuggle.

[angrily]
Who are you people?
Mr. Neary, please, one more question.
Have you recently had a close encounter... A close encounter with something very unusual?

[cautiously]
Who are you people?

[as Lacombe and Laughlin show him a drawing of Devil's Tower]
Yeah, I've got one just like it in my living room. WHO ARE YOU PEOPLE?

[on the police inquiring about her missing son]
They asked me if I'd seen any strangers in the neighborhood.
[Trying to get his kids to look for UFOs at 4 AM]
It's better than Goofy Golf!
Hey! This is not your toy to play with every time I turn around!
He looks like a Fifty-Fifty Bar!
[a farmer is one of several people, including Roy and Jillian, who witnesses three UFOs flying over an Indiana road]
They can fly rings around the moon. But we're *years* ahead of them on the highway.
Are you OK sir?
Yeah, I'm fine! And the only gas around here is from you guys farting around!

[to Toby]
Let go of this fence right now. You come with me. Do you want me to hit you? You let go of that fence!
[Roy's wife does not believe how he got the burns on his face]
Well they're not moon burns, goddamnit.

[to Roy Neary]
I envy you.

[over a loudspeaker at The Dark Side of the Moon]
Could we have the lights in the arena down 60 percent, please... 60 percent.
[the lights go down and running lights turn on one at a time up the runway]
I don't think we could have asked for a more beautiful evening, do you? Okay, watch the skies please... We now show uncorrelated targets approaching from the north-northwest.
Clean everything up!
